oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crop rotation limits Canada thistle, but not Couch grass or annual weeds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rasmussen, I.
Askegaard, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop combinations and interactions
Weed management
Soil tillage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Direct weed control of annual as well as perennial weeds was necessary to reduce the amount of weeds in organic crop rotation experiments at three locations in Denmark. For Canada thistle, however, the rotation was the most important controlling factor: the rotation with grass-clover had less thistle biomass than the one without.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Danish Research Centre for Organic Farming (DARCOF)
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Rasmussen, I. and Askegaard, M. (2004) Crop rotation limits Canada thistle, but not Couch grass or annual weeds. DARCOFenews (4).
